reviews.review_msg: her lectures can be boring and sometimes she  will NOT make sense. HOWEVER she posts easily accessible guides on her canvas page which are pretty much cheat sheets for the assignments. The content may be very confusing which I will not deny, but if you can; try to take notes because they will help. shes a chill person tho. not that bad

I have had three courses with Suzanna and I wish I had more! She's a great prof who is very passionate. If you don't understand statistics I'm very confident that Suzanna would be able to guide you through this course. Sometimes the lectures can be a bit boring and redundant to the asynchronous things she posts though.

The best Q prof in the SA department causes you don't really have a choice. She is really nice and also makes sure you understand the assignment. MAKE SURE YOU GO TO HER OFFICE HOURS IF YOU ARE CONFUSED ABOUT THE ASSIGNMENT, She can teach you how to do your assignment during office hours so really recommend going to the office hours.

Suzanna is very caring, and will be a great help if you need. She is also very knowledgeable surrounding the courses she teaches. However, she can be a tad unorganized and flustered. Overall, I think she's a good prof for what she teaches(not the best course for us social science students because stats are scary lol).

This class was so overwhelming. There were way too many assignments that took a lot of time to complete and were only worth a little each. Her grading criteria is confusing and her lectures do not really make sense, she contradicts herself a lot. Overall don't take unless you have to and the only reason I didn't fully breakdown was cause of the TA

Suzanna knows her stuff, but can't teach. We had a lot of assignments that were done over SPSS and her tutorials did not help. Her instructions were all over the place and did not make sense. Assignments were done with a partner and even with COVID-19, she still expected you to finish everything. FINAL PROJECT WAS STUPID! Only passed bc of the TA!!

The lectures and midterm were super long and disorganized, filled with grammatical/spelling errors, and concepts/definitions were not explained clearly. There were so many readings from random, badly written sociology websites, the assignments were long, unclear and due every 1-2 weeks, and the midterm average was 55%. Worst class I've ever taken!!

Such a sweet lady. But every assignment we are scrambling to figure out her expectations. Criteria for assignments is not clear, neither are the SPSS commands. No class time in the first part of the semester to work on assignments. Goes through too much material, too quickly. Sometimes unresponsive to emails. Midterm review Qs were sloppily done.

Nick is a very light hearted prof but he doesn't teach well at all. He is very jumpy with his content. I have had one in-class course with him and now one remote-learning class. In both he talks a LOT but never clearly gets to the point. His email responses are very vague and only consist of a few words or one sentence

Professor Scott is super helpful and caring IF you go during office hours. He almost always allows extensions on reasonable matters which is nice but you're graded on very little assignments and lectures don't discuss how to code.

Laid back prof with a big heart for helping students succeed. If you're having difficulty with the material, talk to him immediately. Projects are flexible. Don't be afraid to be bold with your ideas.

Amazing! Great class that actually made statistics look like something other than gibberish. If it's a required course take the pre-req the semester before you take this and the class will make sense. SPSS finally makes some sense!

Barbara is a great prof. She made this course as easy as possible however the whole course and statistics were hard for me because I am not good at it ! but she really tries to makes it easy for students and gives tests to break the grade number and if you read her stuff you can ace the tests

She was very enthusiastic and interested in the topic. Quantitative Research in general is a bit complicated but it seemed like she tried to make things as easy as possible for us. Gives you lots of class time to work on projects. If you just go talk to her she'll give you ideas and help you with any problems. I enjoyed her class.
